etymology.description: Depicts a stylized hand. The top stroke is the bent middle finger, and the horizontal strokes each represent two fingers.
etymology.interpretation: 扌 is a simplified form of 手 (shǒu, 'hand'), retaining the key elements that visually represent a human hand. It is commonly used as a component in other characters related to hand actions.
etymology.simplification: 扌 is derived as a cursive or shorthand form of 手 (shǒu, 'hand'), making it easier to incorporate into complex characters as a radical or component.

examples.chinese: 他伸出扌接住了飞来的球(他伸出手接住了飛來的球)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shēnchū shǒu jiēzhù le fēilái de qiú.
examples.english: He stretched out his hand to catch the flying ball.

examples.chinese: 她用扌制作美丽的陶艺(她用手製作美麗的陶藝)，展现她的匠心(展現她的匠心)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yòng shǒu zhìzuò měilì de táoyì, zhǎnxiàn tā de jiàngxīn.
examples.english: She used her hand to create beautiful pottery, showcasing her craftsmanship.

examples.chinese: 艺术家细心雕刻扌的每一细节(藝術家細心雕刻手的每一細節)。
examples.pinyin: Yìshùjiā xìxīn diāokè shǒu de měiyī xìjié.
examples.english: The artist meticulously carved every detail of the hand.
